_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



Nor-Am Cold Storage, located in Schuyler, Nebraska, is a full service Public Refrigerated Warehouse, which provides complete refrigeration, transportation, logistics, and export services to the food industry.  Nor-Am has another cold storage location in Le Mars, Iowa.  As stated on their website, "Our facilities are centrally located in the midwest with easy access to highways and rail. We have the desire and the business experience to provide consistent excellent service to our customers.  Please review our capabilities and contact us.  You will find doing business with NOR-AM simple, pleasant and profitable."



Nor-Am's senior management is not only committed to offer superior service, but also maintain a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



The ammonia refrigeration system at Nor-Am Cold Storage was built in 2004.  The facility is located at 481 Road 9, Schuyler, Nebraska 68661.  The system was constructed in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations.



The ammonia refrigeration system uses approximately 31,000 pounds of ammonia for freezers and cold storage.  The majority of the system including vessels and compressors is located in the machine room.  The condensers are mounted on the machine room roof, and all of the evaporators are located in their respective freezer/cold storage areas.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



The Nor-Am Cold Storage facility including the ammonia system was designed and constructed in 2004 in accordance with the appropriate building and fire codes.



The Nor-Am Cold Storage ammonia refrigeration system has many safety features.  Much of the safety of the system is inherent in the policies and procedures that govern the operation of the system.    For example, the N

or-Am Cold Storage operates in accordance with OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation.



Other safety features of the ammonia refrigeration system include: an ammonia sensor that sounds a facility-wide alarm, an emergency shut down button that kills power to the engine room equipment, relief valves on all pressure vessels, and continuous ventilation in the machine room to prevent ammonia explosions.



In addition to the Uniform Mechanical Code, the facility has based its maintenance program on the industry standard: the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) guidelines.  In particular, the IIAR Bulletin 110, "Start-up, Inspection, and Maintenance of Ammonia Refrigeration Systems" is used at the facility.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no accidental ammonia releases at the Nor-Am facility since system startup in early  2004.  There have been no injuries due to ammonia system.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Nor-Am Cold Storage has an emergency response plan in effect at the facility.  The Emergency Response Plan (Plan) is detailed in the Emergency Planning and Response section of the PSM document, which is maintained at the facility.  This Plan was designed to meet the following objectives:



  1.)  To save lives.

  2.)  To minimize and avoid injuries.

  3.)  To protect the environment.

  4.)  To minimize property damage.



Nor-Am Cold Storage maintains a safety committee whose members are the designated emergency coordinators for the facility.  The Plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards, and mitigation procedures which will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise at the facility.  This Plan is reviewed and updated at least once per year.  This Plan will be reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with the PSM and RMP regulations, as well as to incorporate facility changes due to the renovation of the facility.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



The Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) performed on March of 2009, generated mitigation measures (recommendations) to improve safety at the Nor-Am Cold Storage facility located at 481 Road 9, Nebraska 68661.  The Nor-Am Cold Storage safety committee has completed several items, including the recommendations, in a continual effort to provide a safe work environment for their employees.  These changes include the following items:



1.    Continue to train all employees in Process Safety Management and the facility Safety Plan/Programs.



2.    Continue to have employee involvement in Safety Plan Development.



3.    Continue employee involvement through safety team participation.



4.    Continue internal and external safety audits/inspections and implement changes as needed.
